children.markdown:
Ah, dear. Nearly 7pm on a Friday evening and I’m still in the office. I really must get around to acquiring a life. However, I have just come across a couple of interesting bits in our blogs that I wanted to share with you.
Those of you who enjoyed this blog’s days commenting on architecture (and, frankly, I’m thinking of you, [Brian](http://www.brianmicklethwait.com/)), will enjoy Contract Journal‘s [Construction Projects World](http://www.contractjournal.com/blogs/construction-projects-world/). Mark is posting loads of great images, like [this one](http://www.contractjournal.com/blogs/construction-projects-world/2007/12/hong_kong_is_number_one.html):[![Hong Kong Skyline](https://i0.wp.com/www.onemanandhisblog.com/content/images/2008/01/HongKongSkyline1-thumb-470x79.jpg?resize=470%2C79)](https://i0.wp.com/www.onemanandhisblog.com/content/images/2008/01/HongKongSkyline1.jpg)And James Garner, the web editor of *Computer Weekly*, has posted a list of the [top 10 most popular posts](http://www.computerweekly.com/blogs/editors-blog/2008/01/the-top-10-blog-posts-on-compu.html) on the IT mag’s stable of blogs. It’s no surprise to me that cheap technology and IT security issues top the list…
